O, o noun [C or U]
(ZERO)
(also o); (also oh) used in speech to mean zero: My phone number is three, one, o, five, one, double o (= 3105100). The year 1705 is usually pronounced seventeen o five.

O exclamation
(EMOTION)
used when addressing someone or something, or when expressing strong emotion: "O! Canada" is the Canadian national anthem.
